page.title: 11Media
page.content: In{Montrose}there are relatively few forms of Media.There is no local TV or radio station or daily newspaper.There is however,a weekly newspaper,{"The {Montrose Review",}which has been in print since 1811 and is Scotland's 2nd oldest newspaper.{"The Review"}moved into new premises about 4 years ago. The nearest radio station is{Radio Tay which is based in Dundee.There are also part-time Hospital radio services at Stracathro and Sunnyside. There are several well-known authors living in{Montrose,}and authors such as Violet Jacobs and Duncan Fraser lived and wrote in{Montrose.} Hugh McDiarmid(Christopher Grieve) wrote some of his earlier works while working with{"The Review"}from 1919 to 1929. The nearest TV Broadcasting Centre is at Aberdeen.
